# Call for Papers: Symposium on Usable Security and Privacy (USEC) 2025

The Symposium on Usable Security and Privacy (USEC) 2025 invites submissions on all aspects of human factors and usability in the context of security and privacy.

USEC '25 aims to bring together researchers already engaged in this interdisciplinary effort with other researchers in relevant areas, encouraging economics, HCI, AI, theoretical computer science, cryptography, psychology, and business studies researchers and practitioners to submit original research. Collaborative research from authors in multiple fields is particularly encouraged.

## Submission Tracks

USEC '25 will feature the following tracks:

*   **Research Track:** For mature, completed work. Papers must not be more than **12 pages** in length (excluding bibliography and appendices). Longer papers should scale length according to contributions.
*   **Meta-Science Track:** For mature work focused on research practices, replicability, and systematization of knowledge. Papers must not exceed **12 pages** (excluding bibliography and appendices). Supplementary appendices are encouraged.
*   **Vision Track:** For work in progress or concrete ideas for future work. Papers must be up to **5 pages** in length (excluding bibliography and appendices).

## Submission Guidelines

*   All submissions must be original work and clearly document any overlap with previously published or simultaneously submitted papers.
*   Papers must be written in English.
*   **Font:** Times, 10-point or larger, with 11-point or larger line spacing.
*   **Templates:** Use the [templates for NDSS Symposium and co-located events](https://www.ndss-symposium.org/ndss2025/submissions/templates/).
*   **Submission Portal:** [https://usec25.hotcrp.com/](https://usec25.hotcrp.com/)
*   **Reviewing:** Double-blind. Author names and affiliations should not appear in the paper. Reasonable effort must be made to ensure anonymity in text, figures, photos, links, etc. Prior work should preferably be referred to in the third person or blinded.
*   Author names cannot be changed after acceptance without Program Chairs' approval.
*   At least one author of each accepted paper must attend USEC 2025 and present their paper.

## Areas of Interest

Topics include, but are not limited to:

*   Innovative security or privacy functionality and design
*   New applications of existing models or technology
*   Usability evaluations of new or existing security or privacy features and lessons learned
*   Security testing of new or existing usability features
*   Psychological, sociological, and economic aspects of security and privacy
*   Research and design methodologies for human-centric security and privacy research
*   Reports of replicating previously published studies and experiments
*   Reports of failed usable privacy/security studies or experiments, with the focus on the lessons learned
*   Systematization of Knowledge (SoK)
*   Inclusive security and privacy
*   Ethics in human-centric security and privacy research
*   Workforce, labels, cyber-physical systems
*   Usability in smart manufacturing

*All submissions must clearly relate to the human aspects of security or privacy.* Papers on security or privacy without addressing usability/human factors, or on usability/human factors without addressing security/privacy, will not be considered.

## Awards

*   **Test of Time Award:** Celebrates research demonstrating enduring relevance and influence in usable security and privacy.

## Important Dates

*   **Submission Deadline:** **25 November 2024**, 11:59 pm, Anywhere-on-earth (AOE)
*   **Reviews Due:** 16 December 2024
*   **Discussion Period:** 16-19 December 2024
*   **Notification of Acceptance:** **20 December 2024**
*   **Camera Ready Deadline:** **28 January 2025**
*   **Workshop Date:** **24 February 2025**

## Sponsorship

We sincerely acknowledge the generous support of **Indiana University Bloomington – Security and Privacy in Informatics, Computing, and Engineering (SPICE)** for sponsoring the awards and certificates.

# UIST 2025: Call for Participation

The ACM Symposium on User Interface Software and Technology (UIST) is the premier forum for innovations in human-computer interfaces. Sponsored by ACM special interest groups on computer-human interaction (SIGCHI) and computer graphics (SIGGRAPH), UIST brings together people from diverse areas, including graphical & web user interfaces, tangible & ubiquitous computing, virtual & augmented reality, multimedia, new input & output devices, Human-Centered AI, and CSCW. The intimate size and intensive program make UIST an ideal opportunity to exchange research results and ideas.

## Deadlines

Note: all deadlines are at 11:59pm AoE unless otherwise specified.

*   **Papers (abstract):** Wednesday, April 2, 2025
*   **Papers (paper PDF):** Wednesday, April 9, 2025
*   **Papers (materials incl. Videos, Supplementary materials, Accessibility alt-text and video subtitles):** Friday, April 11, 2025
*   **Posters:** Friday, July 11, 2025
*   **Demos:** Friday, July 11, 2025
*   **Doctoral Symposium:** Friday, July 11, 2025
*   **Workshops:** Friday, July 11, 2025
*   **Visions:** Friday, July 11, 2025
*   **Lasting Impact:** Monday, June 17, 2025
*   **Student Innovation Contest:** Friday, July 18, 2025

## Papers

Papers are the main medium for conveying new research results at UIST and must describe original, unpublished work.

*   **Abstract due (incl. title, abstract, author list):** Wednesday, April 2, 2025
*   **Papers due (Paper PDF):** Wednesday, April 9, 2025
*   **Materials due (incl. videos, supplementary materials, accessibility alt-text and video subtitles):** Friday, April 11, 2025

### Submission Formatting Guidelines

*   We strongly recommend submitting papers in the 2-column format, but will accept papers for review as either 1- or 2-column paper format if you are authoring in Word.
*   Your submission must be original. UIST only accepts original submissions.
*   Authors should avoid generating content using AI-agents (e.g., LLMs such as ChatGPT or similar), but the usage of these tools is allowed for editing and checking the author’s own text.
*   Revised Papers from Prior Submissions: Authors of previously rejected papers are encouraged to upload the prior version of the paper, corresponding reviews, and summary of changes.

### Submission Information

*   **Submission Platform:** All required materials must be submitted electronically to PCS.
*   **Submission Format and Length:**
    *   We will adopt the ACM TAPS Workflow.
    *   LaTeX authors: submissions are strongly recommended to be in the double-column format using `\documentclass[sigconf,review,anonymous]{acmart}`.
    *   Word authors: submissions should be made using either the double-column or single-column template.
    *   UIST papers are of variable length. Short Papers: 5,000 words or less. Standard Length Papers: 5,000 to 12,000 words. References and appendices are excluded from the word count.
    *   Size: < 20 MB (compressed PDF files are encouraged).
*   **Accompanying Video:** Optional, but highly encouraged. Resolution 1080p or 4k, MP4, H.264 codec, no more than 5 minutes, < 250 MB. Subtitles are required.
*   **Anonymity:** Anonymous, i.e., authors must remove their names and affiliations throughout all submission materials.
*   **Selection Process:** Refereed (program committee and two external reviewers).
*   **Publication:** Archival, published in the ACM Digital Library.

## Posters

Posters provide an interactive forum for presenting work to conference attendees during special poster sessions.

*   **Submission deadline:** Friday, July 11, 2025
*   **Acceptance notification:** Wednesday, August 1, 2025
*   **Camera-ready versions due:** Wednesday, August 8, 2025
*   **Video preview due (optional):** Wednesday, August 8, 2025

### Submission Information

*   **Submission Platform:** All materials must be submitted electronically to PCS 2.0.
*   **Submission Format and Length:**
    *   Poster's Extended Abstract: Not to exceed 2 pages (excluding references).
    *   ACM TAPS Workflow will be adopted.
    *   LaTeX authors: double-column format is required.
    *   Word authors: double-column format is required.
*   **Accompanying Poster:** Recommended physical size is A0 or less.
*   **Accompanying Video:** Optional, highly encouraged.
*   **Anonymity:** IMPORTANT: Anonymous.
*   **Selection Process:** Reviewed, less rigorous than paper review, no rebuttal phase.
*   **Publication:** Semi-archival, included in ACM Digital Library as adjunct proceedings.

## Demos

Demos showcase implementations of novel and compelling interaction concepts, techniques, devices, and systems.

*   **Submission deadline:** Friday, July 11, 2025
*   **Acceptance notification:** Friday, August 1, 2025
*   **Camera-ready versions due:** Friday, August 8, 2025
*   **Video preview due:** Friday, August 8, 2025

### Submission Information

*   **Submission Platform:** All materials must be submitted electronically to PCS 2.0.
*   **Submission Format and Length:**
    *   Demo Abstract: Recommend ~1,500-2,000 words. PDF document describing setup and interaction.
    *   ACM TAPS Workflow will be adopted.
    *   LaTeX authors: double-column format is recommended.
    *   Word authors: double-column or single-column template.
*   **Demo Video:** Should be a standalone demonstration of the work, up to 5 min, includes subtitles.
*   **Anonymity:** Demo submissions are not anonymous.
*   **Selection Process:** Juried by demo chairs; no feedback or rebuttal phase.
*   **Publication:** Non-archival. Demo abstracts may be included in ACM Digital Library as Adjunct Proceedings.

## Doctoral Symposium

The UIST Doctoral Symposium provides an opportunity for Ph.D. students to interact with researchers and receive feedback on their research.

*   **Submission deadline:** Friday, July 11, 2025
*   **Acceptance notification:** Friday, August 1, 2025
*   **Camera-ready versions due:** Friday, August 8, 2025
*   **Doctoral Symposium date:** Sunday, September 28, 2025

### Submission Information

*   **Eligibility:** Current Ph.D. students, ideally entering third year or later.
*   **Submission Platform:** All submission materials must be submitted electronically to PCS 2.0.
*   **Submission Format and Length:** Maximum of 4 pages + references in 2-column format.
*   **Anonymity:** Not anonymous.
*   **Selection Process:** Juried based on anticipated contributions to intellectual discussions.
*   **Publication:** Non-archival. Abstracts included in ACM digital library as adjunct proceedings.

## Workshops

Workshops provide an interactive forum to discuss designated areas of interest.

*   **Submission deadline:** Friday, July 11, 2025
*   **Acceptance notification:** Friday, August 1, 2025
*   **Workshop description camera-ready version due (optional):** Friday, August 8, 2025
*   **Workshop date:** Sunday, September 28, 2025

### Submission Information

*   **Submission Platform:** All materials must be submitted electronically to PCS 2.0.
*   **Submission Format and Length:** Extended Abstract, not exceeding 2 pages (excluding references). Double-column ACM paper template.
*   **Anonymity:** Not anonymous.
*   **Selection Process:** Juried.
*   **Publication:** Optional inclusion in ACM Digital Library as adjunct proceedings.

## Visions

UIST Visions is a venue for forward-thinking ideas to inspire the community and project the UIST community as thought leaders.

*   **Submission deadline:** Friday, July 11, 2025
*   **Acceptance notification:** Friday, August 8th, 2025

### Submission Information

*   **Eligibility:** Single Author.
*   **Submission Platform:** All submission materials must be submitted electronically to PCS 2.0.
*   **Submission Format and Length:** Up to 1000 words (excluding references), roughly 1 page.
*   **Anonymity:** Not anonymous.
*   **Selection Process:** Curated by Vision Chairs; up to two speakers selected.
*   **Publication:** Non-archival. Abstracts included in ACM digital library as adjunct proceedings.

## Lasting Impact

Recognizes UIST papers that have had a long-lasting influence on the field.

*   **Award nomination deadline:** Monday, June 17, 2025, 11:59 PM AoE

### Nomination Process

Send an email to lastingimpact2025@uist.org with nominator details, nominated paper reference, a one-sentence description of impact, and a nomination letter.

# USENIX ATC '25 Call for Papers

The 2025 USENIX Annual Technical Conference (ATC '25) will be held from **July 7–9, 2025**, at the **Sheraton Boston in Boston, MA, USA**. It is co-located with the **19th USENIX Symposium on Operating Systems Design and Implementation (OSDI '25)**.

## Overview

The USENIX ATC '25 seeks original, high-quality submissions that improve and further the knowledge of computing systems, with an emphasis on implementations and experimental results. Submissions are welcome for systems of all scales, from embedded mobile devices to data centers and clouds. The scope covers all practical aspects related to computer systems, including operating systems, runtime systems, parallel and distributed systems, storage, networking, security and privacy, virtualization, software-hardware interactions, performance evaluation, reliability, energy management, and bug-finding.

USENIX ATC '25 particularly encourages new ideas and approaches, and values submissions accompanied by clearly defined artifacts (traces, data, source code, tools) not previously available.

## Submission Guidelines

*   Submissions must contain original unpublished material that is not under review at any other forum.
*   Papers will be judged on relevance, novelty, technical merit, correctness, and clarity. Flawed ideas or designs may lead to rejection.
*   **USENIX ATC '25 will employ double-blind reviewing.** Papers that are not properly anonymized may be rejected without review.
*   Papers need to be registered, and their abstracts submitted by the abstract registration deadline. Papers with an empty abstract will be rejected.
*   An optional artifact evaluation process will be available for accepted papers.

## Submission Type: Full vs. Short

*   **Full submissions:** Must not exceed **12 pages** (excluding references and appendices).
*   **Short submissions:** Must not exceed **6 pages** (excluding references and appendices).
*   Both types are reviewed to the same standards and differ primarily in scope. Short papers present a complete idea that is properly evaluated.
*   Optionally, authors can include an appendix for material not central to the contributions (e.g., algorithm details, proofs, code snippets).
*   For further details, see the [submission instructions](https://www.usenix.org/conference/atc25/submission-instructions).

## Deployed Systems Track

USENIX ATC '25 solicits papers describing the design, implementation, analysis, and experience with real-world deployment of systems and networks. These papers need not present new ideas but should convey practical insights. Note that submission and anonymization rules differ for this track.

## Important Dates

*   **Abstract registrations due:** Tuesday, January 7, 2025, 11:59 pm UTC
*   **Submissions due:** Tuesday, January 14, 2025, 11:59 pm UTC
*   **Authors' response period:** Monday, April 7–Wednesday, April 9, 2025, 11:59 pm UTC
*   **Notification to authors:** Friday, April 25, 2025
*   **Final papers due:** Tuesday, June 3, 2025

## On the Use of Generative AI

Authors must not submit papers containing sections generated entirely by generative AI. Authors must submit a statement attesting that their paper does not include sections completely created by generative AI as part of the submission process in HotCRP.

## Contact Information

Please direct any questions to the program co-chairs at [atc25chairs@usenix.org](mailto:atc25chairs@usenix.org) or to the USENIX office at [submissionspolicy@usenix.org](mailto:submissionspolicy@usenix.org).

The **22nd IEEE International Conference on Ubiquitous Intelligence and Computing (UIC 2025)** will be held as a **hybrid event** in **Calgary, Alberta, Canada**, from **August 18 - 22, 2025**.

Ubiquitous intelligence, distributed throughout the physical environment, is paving the way towards a smart world, enabling new breeds of applications and systems by enhancing everyday objects with intelligence. # Call for Papers: IEEE VIS 2025

# UMAP 2025: Call for Full and Short Papers

We invite prospective authors to submit contributions to the 33rd ACM International Conference on User Modeling, Adaptation and Personalization (UMAP 2025). UMAP 2025 is the premier international conference bringing together research in AI and HCI to support effective human-AI collaboration via interactive systems that can model, adapt and personalize to their users.

The conference is sponsored by ACM SIGCHI and SIGWEB. The main conference proceedings, published by ACM, will be part of the ACM Digital Library.

## Theme

The theme of ACM UMAP 2025 is **“Shaping Personalization and FATE (Fairness, Accountability, Transparency, and Ethics) in Human-Centered Generative AI”**.

ACM UMAP 2025 will bring together researchers, practitioners, and policymakers to discuss the latest developments in human-centered approaches to design and use AI systems that adapt to human needs while ensuring user control, fairness, accountability, transparency, inclusivity, and sustainability.

## Important Dates

*   **Abstract submission:** January 23, 2025
*   **Paper submission:** January 30, 2025
*   **Rebuttal phase:** March 3-7, 2025
*   **Notification of acceptance:** March 26, 2025
*   **Camera-ready papers:** April 7, 2025
*   **Registration deadline for authors:** April 7, 2025
*   **Conference:** June 16-19, 2025

*Note: The submission deadline is at 11:59 pm AoE (Anywhere on Earth) time.* For special tracks, please consult the respective calls.

## Topics of Interest

Topics include, but are not limited to:

*   Recommender systems
*   Data mining techniques for user modeling, adaptation, and personalization
*   Generative AI techniques for user modeling, adaptation, and personalization
*   Large Language Models and Natural Language Processing methods for user modeling, adaptation, and personalization
*   Knowledge graphs, Linked Data, and semantics for user modeling, adaptation, and personalization
*   Intelligent user interfaces
*   Intelligent and personalized e-learning applications and educational games
*   Personalized behavior change and persuasive applications
*   Modeling and adapting to human affective states
*   Virtual assistants, conversational agents, personalization in augmented reality
*   Group modeling and collaborative team formation
*   Ethical issues of personalization and human-centered AI systems: Privacy, Fairness, Accountability, Transparency
*   Creativity in User Modeling, Adaptation, and Personalization
*   Sustainability-aware methods and Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) for user modeling, adaptation, and personalization
*   Personalized approaches for preventing eco-chambers, user manipulation, and disinformation
*   Research methods and reproducibility

## Submission Guidelines

*   **Language:** All submissions must be written in English.
*   **Format:** PDF format.
*   **Submission System:** Submit electronically through EasyChair: [https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=umap2025](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=umap2025), selecting the “UMAP25 Full and Short Papers” track.
*   **Contribution Types:**
    *   **Long papers:** Up to 8 pages (plus additional pages for references; all content counts toward the page limit). Should report substantial contributions of lasting value.
    *   **Short papers:** Up to 4 pages (plus additional pages for references; all content counts toward the page limit). Typically discuss exciting new work that is not yet mature enough for a long paper.
*   **Supplementary Material:** Recommend linking to an external source using an anonymized link.
*   **Anonymity:** Submissions must be anonymous due to the double-blind review process. Omit names, affiliations, and identifying statements. Cite prior work in the third person. Failure to anonymize may result in desk rejection. Anonymous repositories like [https://anonymous.4open.science](https://anonymous.4open.science) can be used for code/materials.
*   **Templates:**
    *   **LaTeX:** Use the latest version of the Primary Article Template – LaTeX. Start with `\documentclass[sigconf,review,anonymous]{acmart}` for double-column output. Follow ACM's LaTeX best practices guide. Do not use the "manuscript" option.
    *   **Overleaf:** Use `\documentclass[sigconf,review,anonymous]{acmart}` for double-column. Follow ACM's instructions for preparing articles with Overleaf.
    *   **Word:** Use the double-column Word template. Follow ACM's instructions for preparing articles with Microsoft Word.

## Accessibility

Authors are strongly encouraged to provide "alt text" for floats (images, tables, etc.) and follow ACM Accessibility Recommendations for Publishing in Color and SIG ACCESS guidelines.

## Submission Policy

*   ACM UMAP has a no dual submission policy. Submitted manuscripts should not be under review at another publication venue.
*   Authors must comply with all ACM Publications Policies, including those on Research Involving Human Participants and Subjects.
*   Authors are required to obtain an ORCID ID.

## Review Process

*   **Review:** ACM UMAP uses a **double-blind review process**. Submissions must be anonymous.
*   Reviewers evaluate papers based on significance, originality, rigor, and contribution.
*   Papers out of scope, incomplete, or lacking sufficient evidence may be rejected without full review.
*   A rebuttal stage will be available for authors to optionally discuss the initial decision.
*   The ACM Code of Ethics will be considered; papers perpetuating harmful stereotypes or employing unethical research practices may be rejected.

## Registration and Presentation Policy

*   Each accepted paper must be accompanied by a **distinct full author registration** by the early registration date.
*   Each accepted paper **must be presented in person** to be included in the conference proceedings and the ACM Digital Library.

## Camera-ready Submission

*   Instructions for preparing camera-ready versions will be provided after acceptance.
*   LaTeX/Overleaf is strongly recommended for minimal reformatting.
*   Camera-ready versions will be submitted using ACM’s new production platform.

## Ethical & Human Subjects Considerations

*   Papers should discuss ethical considerations and the impact of the work.
*   Authors must comply with ethical standards and regulatory guidelines for human subjects research.
*   Papers reporting on human subjects research must include a statement identifying regulatory review approval or explaining the lack thereof.

## Program Chairs

*   Cataldo Musto, University of Bari Aldo Moro, Italy
*   Julita Vassileva, University of Saskatchewan, Canada

# VEHITS 2026: Call for Papers

The International Conference on Vehicle Technology and Intelligent Transport Systems (VEHITS) 2026 is an event dedicated to bringing together engineers, researchers, and practitioners interested in the advances and applications in the field of Vehicle Technology and Intelligent Transport Systems.

VEHITS 2026 will be held from **May 18 to May 20, 2026**, and is sponsored by INSTICC – Institute for Systems and Technologies of Information, Control and Communication.

## Scope

This conference focuses on innovative applications, tools, and platforms across all technology areas related to vehicles and intelligent transportation systems. # Call for Papers: IEEE VISSOFT 2025

The thirteenth IEEE Working Conference on Software Visualization (VISSOFT 2025) is principally a venue for publishing and discussing research related to software visualization. It brings together a community of researchers from software engineering, information visualization, human-computer interaction, computer graphics, and data science to discuss theoretical foundations, algorithms, techniques, tools, and applications related to software visualization.

VISSOFT 2025 will be held from **September 7-8, 2025**, and is co-located with ICSME 2025.

## Topics of Interest

Software visualization is a broad research area. Topics include, but are not limited to, the visualization of:

*   **Software Engineering data:** source code, dependencies, repositories, developer social networks (e.g., StackOverflow, GitHub), mobile app reviews, documentation, runtime logs, and DevOps data.
*   **Software development activities:** design, requirements engineering, software maintenance, program comprehension, software performance, software testing, and debugging.
*   **Software analytical approaches** based on data science concepts.
*   **Empirical evaluations** of software visualizations, including eye-tracking studies.
*   **Tools, techniques, and frameworks** that include visual programming languages.
*   **Interactive and immersive techniques and algorithms** related to software development.
*   **Integrating tools** with development environments.
*   **Industrial experience** with using software visualization.
*   **Techniques used in Software Engineering Education**.
*   **Application of trendy techniques** such as Machine Learning and AI-assisted models (Large Language Models, Large Multi-Modal Models with Software).
*   **Application of techniques** such as Augmented and Virtual Reality, and Sonification, to software engineering activities.

## Submission Types

### Research Track

*   **Description:** In-depth and mature research results relevant to software visualization.
*   **Page Limit:** Maximum of 10 pages (including figures, tables, appendices), plus up to two additional pages for the bibliography.
*   **Submission Link:** [https://easychair.org/conferences?conf=vissoft2025](https://easychair.org/conferences?conf=vissoft2025)
*   **Important Dates (AoE):**
    *   Paper Abstract: **May 16, 2025**
    *   Paper Submission: **May 23, 2025**
    *   Notification: **July 4, 2025**
*   **Supplementary Materials:** Submission of a video (up to 5 minutes) and/or reproduction packages is highly encouraged.
*   **Awards:** Distinguished technical papers may be awarded and invited for extended submission to the IEEE Transactions on Visualization and Computer Graphics journal.
*   **Artifact Evaluation:** Authors are encouraged to submit artifacts for evaluation.

### New Ideas and Emerging Results (NIER) Track

*   **Description:** Work-in-progress, preliminary, and exciting ideas and results. Encourages open questions and provocative hypotheses for early feedback.
*   **Page Limit:** Maximum of 5 pages (including bibliography).
*   **Submission Link:** [https://easychair.org/conferences?conf=vissoft2025](https://easychair.org/conferences?conf=vissoft2025)
*   **Important Dates (AoE):**
    *   Paper Abstract: **May 16, 2025**
    *   Paper Submission: **May 23, 2025**
    *   Notification: **July 4, 2025**
*   **Awards:** Distinguished NIER papers may be awarded.

### Tools Track

*   **Description:** Submissions describing already implemented and functional tools, focusing on architecture or use for new insights. Evolutions of previously presented tools are also welcome.
*   **Page Limit:** Short papers: 4 pages (+ 1 page for bibliography). Long papers: 10 pages (+ 2 pages for bibliography).
*   **Submission Link:** [https://easychair.org/conferences?conf=vissoft2025](https://easychair.org/conferences?conf=vissoft2025)
*   **Important Dates (AoE):**
    *   Paper Abstract: **May 16, 2025**
    *   Paper Submission: **May 23, 2025**
    *   Notification: **July 4, 2025**
*   **Video Submission:** Mandatory (up to 5 minutes).
*   **Showcase Session:** Informal tool demonstration session.
*   **Artifact Evaluation:** Authors are encouraged to submit tools and artifacts for evaluation.

### Journal-First Track

*   **Description:** Presentation of papers accepted by relevant journals published between July 1, 2023, and July 11, 2025, reporting new research results.
*   **Submission Requirements:** A one-page presentation proposal including paper title, authors, statement on criteria satisfaction, and a pointer to the original journal paper.
*   **Publication:** Journal-first manuscripts are published through journals, not conference proceedings.
*   **Submission Link:** [https://easychair.org/conferences?conf=vissoft2025](https://easychair.org/conferences?conf=vissoft2025)
*   **Important Dates (AoE):**
    *   Paper Submission: **July 11, 2025**
    *   Notification: **July 16, 2025**

### Poster Track

*   **Description:** Opportunity for researchers and practitioners to present new and innovative preliminary work in an informal, interactive setting.
*   **Manuscript:** Two-page documents.
*   **Publication:** Poster manuscripts will be part of the Conference proceedings.
*   **Submission Link:** [https://easychair.org/conferences?conf=vissoft2025](https://easychair.org/conferences?conf=vissoft2025)
*   **Important Dates (AoE):**
    *   Paper Submission: **July 11, 2025**
    *   Notification: **July 16, 2025**

### Visualization Challenge Track (NEW!)

*   **Description:** Contribution of expertise focused on a single software system (this year: the Linux kernel) to reveal new understandings.
*   **Submission:** Short abstract, video (up to 5 minutes), optional link to tool demo.
*   **Evaluation:** Primarily novelty and interest.

# VMCAI 2025: Call for Papers

VMCAI 2025 is the 26th International Conference on Verification, Model Checking, and Abstract Interpretation, taking place from **January 20-21, 2025**, in **Denver, Colorado, United States**. The conference is co-located with POPL 2025.

VMCAI provides a forum for researchers from the communities of Verification, Model Checking, and Abstract Interpretation, facilitating interaction, cross-fertilization, and advancement of hybrid methods that combine these and related areas.

## Scope

The program will consist of refereed research papers, invited lectures, and tutorials. Research contributions can report new results as well as experimental evaluations and comparisons of existing techniques.

## Topics of Interest

Topics include, but are not limited to:

*   Program Verification
*   Model Checking
*   Abstract Interpretation
*   Abstract Domains
*   Program Synthesis
*   Static Analysis
*   Type Systems
*   Deductive Methods
*   Program Logics
*   First-Order Theories
*   Decision Procedures
*   Interpolation
*   Horn Clause Solving
*   Program Certification
*   Separation Logic
*   Probabilistic Programming and Analysis
*   Error Diagnosis
*   Detection of Bugs and Security Vulnerabilities
*   Program Transformations
*   Hybrid and Cyber-physical Systems
*   Concurrent and distributed Systems
*   Analysis of numerical properties
*   Analysis of smart contracts
*   Analysis of neural networks
*   Case Studies on all of the above topics

Submissions can address any programming paradigm, including concurrent, constraint, functional, imperative, logic, and object-oriented programming.

## Submission Categories and Page Limits

Submissions are required to follow Springer’s LNCS format. The page limit depends on the paper’s category. Additional material beyond the page limit may be placed in a clearly marked appendix.

*   **Regular papers:** Clearly identify and justify an advance to the field. Supported by experimental validation where applicable. **20 pages** (not counting references).
*   **Tool papers:** Present a new tool, component, or extensions. Emphasize design and implementation. **12 pages** (not counting references).

*   **Contribution Categories:** Papers should cover one or more of the following: methodological, technical, applications, and systems.
    *   **Methodological papers:** Describe advances in theories and methods of AR/VR/MR and 3DUI.
    *   **Technical papers:** Describe advancements in algorithms or devices critical to AR/VR/MR and 3DUI development.
    *   **Application papers:** Explain how existing ideas were applied to solve a problem, including an evaluation of success.
    *   **System papers:** Indicate how techniques and technologies were integrated to produce an effective system and convey lessons learned.
*   **Evaluation:** Each paper must include an evaluation of its contributions (e.g., user studies, benchmarking).
*   **Submission Length:** Between 4 and 9 pages (excluding references), with an additional 2 pages for references. Supplementary materials and videos are encouraged.
*   **Formatting:** Papers must be formatted using the [IEEE Computer Society VGTC conference format](https://tc.computer.org/vgtc/publications/conference/).

### Topics

IEEE VR 2025 seeks contributions in VR/AR/MR and 3DUI including, but not limited to:

*   360° video
*   3D and volumetric display and projection technology
*   3D authoring
*   3D user interfaces
*   Accessibility of immersive interfaces
*   Audio interfaces and rendering
*   Collaborative interactions
*   Computer graphics techniques
*   Crowd simulation

*   User experience and usability

### Review Process

The review process has two cycles:

*   **Review Cycle I (Submission to Initial notification):** Submissions are assigned to two IPC members. Early rejection for submissions violating guidelines or receiving low scores. Double-blind stage. Striving for at least three reviews per submission. Initial recommendations: Conditionally accept as IEEE TVCG paper, Conditionally accept as conference paper, Recommend as a two-page poster, or Reject.
*   **Review Cycle II (Initial notification to Final decision):** Revision of conditionally accepted papers reviewed by the coordinator for final recommendation.

### Additional Guidelines

*   **Abstract Submission:** Abstract must be uploaded seven days prior to the paper submission deadline.
*   **Ethics and Responsibility:** All research experiments with human participants must follow institutional ethical guidelines and secure ethics committee approval. Approval details must be reported in the submission system.
*   **Participant Diversity:** Research with human participants should strive for participant diversity and report demographics. Submissions making general claims with imbalanced participant groups may be negatively impacted.
*   **Review Duties for Authors:** One author per submitted paper must register to review up to three papers through PCS.
*   **Presentation at the Conference:** All accepted submissions must be presented orally at the conference. In-person presentation is expected; online presentations are accommodated only in exceptional cases.
*   **Submission Language:** All submissions must be in English.
*   **Previous Publication and Plagiarism:** Submitted manuscripts must not have been previously published or simultaneously under consideration elsewhere. Builds upon prior work can be submitted with additional papers and an explanation letter (seen by primary reviewer). Plagiarism will be checked using IEEE Crosscheck and may lead to rejection.
*   **AI-generated Text:** Large-scale language models (LLMs) can only be used for grammar editing.
*   **Submission Anonymity:** IEEE VR uses a DOUBLE-BLIND review process. Submissions must not contain author identifying information. Citations to authors' previous work must be in the third person. Failure to adhere to the double-blind policy will result in desk rejection.
*   **Pre-dissemination:** Uploading manuscripts to online repositories before the review process does not constitute a reason for rejection but can compromise anonymity.
*   **Videos:** Videos must be submitted according to instructions, free of identifying information. Accepted videos for the video proceedings will require a revised version.

# W2GIS 2025: Call for Papers

The 22nd International Symposium on Web and Wireless Geographical Information Systems (W2GIS 2025) invites high-quality submissions of three types of contributions: full papers, work in progress papers, and showcase papers. The conference will take place in **Mexico City, Mexico, from September 8-9, 2025**.

## Focus and Topics

The integration of artificial intelligence, big data, and social networks within GIS presents new opportunities for urban planning, transportation, and sustainability. However, these advancements also bring significant research challenges. As the conference takes place for the first time in Mexico City and Central America, a key focus is to explore how GIScience, combined with these technologies, can address emerging environmental problems in urban contexts, particularly in relation to sustainable development goals.

Topics to be addressed include, but are not limited to:

*   Geospatial databases and spatio-temporal data management.
*   Mobile spatial interaction and movement analysis.
*   Spatial search, GeoWeb search engines and services.

# VRST 2025: Call for Participation

The ACM Virtual Reality Software and Technology (VRST) 2025 conference will be held on **November 12, 13 & 14, 2025**. VRST is a key venue for presenting cutting-edge research and development in virtual reality software and technology.

## Important Dates

*   **Papers (all materials) Due:** Monday 14 July 2025
*   **Author Notification for Papers:** Monday 1 September 2025
*   **Revised Papers:** Monday 8 September 2025
*   **Final Author Notification for Papers:** Friday 12 September 2025
*   **Camera-Ready Papers:** Monday 15 September 2025
*   **Conference Dates:** Wednesday 12 – Friday 14 November 2025

*Note: Each deadline is 23:59:59 AoE (Anywhere on Earth) == GMT/UTC-12:00 on the stated day.*

## Topics

VRST 2025 welcomes paper submissions relating to the following XR areas:

*   Display technology and interaction devices
*   Low-latency and high-performance software and applications
*   Multi-user and distributed XR
*   XR software environments and authoring systems

*   Locomotion and navigation
*   Perception, presence, and cognition
*   XR applications, e.g. training, medical, fabrication
*   Multi-disciplinary research projects involving innovative use of XR

## Submission Guidelines

All accepted papers will be published in the ACM Digital Library in the VRST collection.

### Format

*   Paper submissions must be **anonymous** for a double-blind review process.
*   All submissions should be prepared using the Word or LaTeX templates from the official ACM Master article template packages and TAPS.
*   **For LaTeX authors:** Submissions should be made using the double-column format with `\documentclass[sigconf,review,anonymous]{acmart}`.
*   **For Word submissions:** Please use the provided single-column template.
*   Authors should prepare their materials using numbered citations and references.

### Submission Lengths

*   **LaTeX:** 4 to 9 pages, double column, excluding references.
*   **Word:** Approximately 8,000 words including space for figures, tables, etc.

### Anonymity Guidelines

*   Remove all author and institution information.
*   Remove any clues that would directly identify authors (e.g., institution names, acknowledgments).
*   Anonymize all PDF files, including file metadata.
*   Citations of the authors’ own published work must be in the third person and not traceable to the authors' identity.
*   Failure to comply will result in automatic desk rejection.

*   Research papers
*   Posters
*   Demos
*   Reproduction Challenge
*   Student Volunteers

## Supplementary Materials

*   Optional materials (images, videos, documents) up to 50MB are allowed.
*   Content should be in portable formats (PDF, HTML, PNG, JPEG, QuickTime, MPEG).
*   These materials do not form part of the official submission and will be viewed at the reviewers' discretion.

## Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

Researchers are encouraged to use representative participant samples for user evaluations and to discuss limitations if non-representative samples are used. Reporting participant demographic information is recommended.

## Accessibility

Authors are asked to make submissions as inclusive as possible, providing alt-text for figures and tables, and accessible supplemental videos with subtitles. Authors facing difficulties can contact the VRST 2025 Accessibility Chairs at [accessibility@vrst2025.org](mailto:accessibility@vrst2025.org).

## Policies

*   At least one author of each accepted paper must register for the conference and present their work **in person**. Remote presentations are not possible.
*   All standing ACM policies apply, including ACM Policy on Authorship and ACM Policy on Prior Publication and Simultaneous Submissions.
*   Authors must obtain an ORCID ID.

## Submission System

Please use the Precision Conferences System (PCS) to submit your work: [https://new.precisionconference.com/vrst2025](https://new.precisionconference.com/vrst2025)

*   Choose “SIGCHI” from the “Society” drop-down list.

# Call For Papers: WAFR 2024

The Workshop on the Algorithmic Foundations of Robotics (WAFR) is a biannual multi-disciplinary single-track meeting for international researchers presenting the latest advances on algorithmic problems in robotics. In 2024, we celebrate **30 years of WAFR** and are planning special events.

WAFR's focus is on the design and analysis of robot algorithms from both theoretical and practical angles. These algorithms process inputs from noisy sensors, build geometric and physical models of the world, plan high- and low-level actions, and execute them on actuators with limited precision. The design and analysis of robot algorithms draw from fields including control theory, computational and differential geometry, and computer science.

## Topics of Interest

The conference encourages submissions on a broad range of topics, including:

*   Algorithmic approaches to human-robot interaction
*   Computational geometry and topology
*   Control theory and optimization
*   Distributed and parallel methods
*   Decision theory and game theory
*   Geometrical and physical modeling
*   Machine learning (supervised, unsupervised, reinforcement, representation, imitation learning)
*   Planning and reasoning under uncertainty
*   Probabilistic and sampling-based algorithms
*   Sensing and perception
*   Task and motion planning
*   Theoretical computer science

Additionally, papers on applications of robot algorithms to important or new domains, including those beyond traditional robotics, are welcome:

*   Assistive and service robotics
*   Brain-controlled robots
*   Computational biology
*   Computer animation, graphics and animation, VR/AR
*   Legged locomotion
*   Manufacturing and automation
*   Multi-agent systems
*   Sensor networks and IoT devices
*   Surgical robots, intelligent prosthetics, rehabilitation robots
*   Transportation networks and systems

## Information for Authors

Information on manuscript preparation and the submission process is available at [this link](authors.php).

## Guidelines Regarding the Use and Disclosure of AI Tools for Authors

*   Generative AI tools and technologies, such as ChatGPT, may not be listed as authors of a paper submitted to WAFR.
*   The use of content generated by AI in an article (including but not limited to text, figures, images, and code) must be disclosed in the acknowledgments section.
*   The AI system used must be identified, and specific sections of the article that use AI-generated content should be specified and accompanied by a brief explanation regarding the manner in which the AI system was used to generate the content.
*   The use of AI systems for editing and grammar enhancement is common practice and, as such, is generally outside the intent of the above policy. Even so, in this case, disclosure is still recommended as the lines between these uses can be difficult to distinguish.

## Guidelines Regarding the Use and Disclosure of AI Tools for Reviewers

Information or content contained in or about a manuscript under review shall not be processed through an AI system. Doing so is considered a breach of confidentiality and as such is not permitted.

# Call for Papers

We invite authors to submit papers describing original research of theoretical or practical significance to the 51st International Workshop on Graph-Theoretic Concepts in Computer Science (WG2025).

WG2025 is the 51st edition of the WG series and will take place from **June 11 to 13, 2025**, with a reception on the evening of **June 10**, at **Europäische Akademie Otzenhausen, Germany**.

This conference is dedicated to the memory of Hartmut Noltemeier, who passed away on May 10, 2025. He was one of the co-founders of WG and organized and chaired the conference three times.

## Aims and Scope

WG is mainly concerned with efficient algorithms of various types (e.g., sequential, parallel, distributed, randomized, parameterized) for problems on graphs and networks. The goal is to present recent results and to identify and explore directions for future research. Submitted papers should describe original results in any aspects of graph theory related to computer science, including but not restricted to:

*   design and analysis of sequential, parallel, randomized, parameterized algorithms
*   distributed graph and network algorithms
*   structural graph theory with algorithmic or complexity applications
*   computational complexity of graph and network problems
*   graph grammars, graph rewriting systems and graph modeling
*   graph drawing and layouts
*   computational geometry

# WMSCI 2025: Call for Papers

The 29th World Multi-Conference on Systemics, Cybernetics and Informatics (WMSCI 2025) will be held from **September 9-12, 2025**, in **Orlando, Florida, USA**, organized by IIIS.

## About the Conference

The purpose of WMSCI 2025 is to promote discussions and interactions between researchers and practitioners focused on disciplinary, interdisciplinary and transdisciplinary issues, ideas, concepts, theories, methodologies and applications. It aims to foster the exchange of concepts, prototypes, research ideas, and other results that could contribute to the academic arena and benefit business and the industrial community.

WMSCI 2025 is an international forum for scientists, engineers, researchers, consultants, theoreticians, and practitioners in the fields of Systemics, Cybernetics, and Informatics. It focuses on specific disciplinary research, as well as multi-, inter-, and trans-disciplinary studies and projects.

## Ways of Participation

Both **Face-to-Face Participation** and **Virtual Participation** are accepted. Both kinds of submissions will have the same reviewing process, and the accepted papers will be included in the same proceedings.

*   **Face-to-Face Participation:** For presenters attending the conference in person.
*   **Virtual Participation:** For presenters unable to attend the conference in person.

## Submission Options

Authors can choose from the following submission types:

### Face-to-Face Participation:

*   **Draft Paper:** (2000-5000 words)
*   **Extended Abstract:** (600-2000 words)
*   **Abstract:** (300-600 words)

### Virtual Participation:

*   **Draft Paper:** (2000-5000 words)
*   **Extended Abstract:** (600-2000 words)

*Note: Title, authors, and references are not included in the word count.*

## Submission Format and Authors' Kit

*   **Submissions Format:** [Read here](https://www.iiis2025.org/wmsci/website/submissionformat.asp?vc=1)
*   **Authors' Kit:** [PDF](https://www.iiis2025.org/wmsci/Contents/AK-WMSCI-2025.pdf) | [DOCX](https://www.iiis2025.org/wmsci/Contents/AK-WMSCI-2025.docx)

## Reviewing Process

All submitted papers/abstracts will go through three reviewing processes: (1) double-blind (at least three reviewers), (2) non-blind, and (3) participative peer reviews. Final acceptance depends on the three kinds of reviews, but a paper must be recommended by non-blind reviewers AND blind reviewers to be accepted for presentation at the conference and included in the proceedings.

## Important Dates

### Current and FINAL Set of Deadlines:

*   **June 6th, 2025:** Submission of draft papers (2000-5000 words) and extended abstracts (600-2000 words).
*   **July 3rd, 2025:** Submission of draft papers (2000-5000 words) and extended abstracts (600-2000 words).
*   **July 9th, 2025:** Notifications of acceptance.
*   **August 7th, 2025:** Submission of camera-ready or final versions of the accepted papers.
*   **September 9th, 2025:** Conference Starts
*   **September 12th, 2025:** Conference Ends

*Note: Some invited sessions or special tracks may have a different timetable according to their organizers and/or chairs.*

## Publication

Authors of the best 25%-30% of the papers presented at the conference (including those virtually presented) will be invited to adapt their papers for publication in the **Journal of Systemics, Cybernetics and Informatics**.

## Registration

Registration of at least one author per paper and the payment of the respective conference fees are necessary for the paper to be included in the Proceedings and its presentation to be scheduled in the Conference Program.

*   [Registration Guide](https://www.iiis2025.org/wmsci/registration/bor2-Guide.asp?vc=1)
*   [Online Registration](https://www.iiis2025.org/wmsci/registration/bor2.asp?vc=1)

## Invited Sessions

Invited Sessions can be organized on a specific or general theme and may grow to Focus Symposia, workshops, satellite events, micro-conferences, or independent/associated spin-offs from WMSCI.

*   [Invited Session Submissions](https://www.iiis2025.org/wmsci/Invitedsession/Registro.asp?vc=1)
*   [How to Organize an Invited Session](https://www.iiis2025.org/wmsci/Invitedsession/ISOrganization.asp?vc=1)

# WorldCIST'25: Call For Papers

Welcome to the 13th World Conference on Information Systems and Technologies (WorldCIST'25), to be held in **Florianópolis, Brazil**, at the Majestic Palace Hotel, from **April 15 to 17, 2025**.
